title_localized.en: June is Miami Film Month for Movie Lovers

Whether you’re a Miami Film Month novice or veteran, here’s everything you need to navigate tickets and the local cinemas like a pro.

post_content_localized.en:
Celebrate Magic City’s unique movie culture during Miami Film Month this June. Plug into the local film community on your SoBe getaway and enjoy screenings for free or at a discounted rate at Miami’s independent art cinemas. Whether you’re a Miami Film Month novice or veteran, here’s everything you need to navigate tickets and the local cinemas like a pro.

Immerse yourself in Miami’s world of film with behind-the-scenes movie bus tours, special screenings of popular and lesser-known works, and discounted movie tickets. Miami Film Month is designed to support local businesses, spread the word about what the city has to offer, and delight visitors on their visit to this sunny paradise. From indie films to internationally renowned blockbusters, make sure to check out the cinema’s online calendars for flicks to catch during Miami Film Month.

Participating independent theatres

  • Cosford Cinema. The University of Miami's School of Communication theater showcases indie and foreign films. Visit in June for showings of The White Crow, Non-Fiction, Hampstead starring Diane Keaton and Brendan Gleeson, and more. 5030 Brunson Dr, Coral Gables

  • Coral Gables Art Cinema. South Florida’s leading art house theater will be playing screenings of Werner Herzog’s Meeting Gorbachev and The Tomorrowman through the month of June. 260 Aragon Ave, Coral Gables

  • Miami Beach Cinematheque. Visit the Cinematheque on SoBe’s busy Washington Avenue for a chance to catch Terry Gilliam’s adventure-comedy, The Man Who Killed Don Quixote, during the month of June. 1130 Washington Ave, Miami Beach

  • O Cinema Miami Beach. Discover one of the most anticipated documentaries of 2019 at O Cinema in Miami Beach this June. Frédéric Tcheng’s Halston takes a look at the influential fashion designer’s rise to fame. 500 71st St, Miami Beach

  • O Cinema Wynwood. Visit Wynwood’s indie cinema as it presents diverse genres of foreign, art, classic, and family films through the month of June. 90 NW 29th St, Miami

  • Tower Theater. Named “one of the 10 great places to see a movie in splendor" by USA Today, Tower Theater is one of Miami’s oldest cultural landmarks. 1508 SW 8th St, Miami 

Organized by the Miami Convention and Visitors Bureau, simply visit a participating venue’s website to sign up for ticket deals. Check MiamiFilmMonth.com for updated information on bus tours and event details. Miami Film Month takes place June 1-30.

Coinciding with Miami Film Month, join Sagamore, BelAir Fine Art, and Markowicz Fine Art galleries as we present Music is Life, an exhibit featuring over 100 artworks entirely dedicated to music by international and local artists. On display now through June 30, 2019.

Choose from our best rates and special offers when you book direct with the Sagamore Hotel, an iconic Miami Beach destination known for its unique collection of contemporary art, spacious suites, and prime location only steps from the white sands of South Beach.
